title: Reform Act 2010 (Sections 20 and 22) Regulations 2011 [S.I. No. 437 of 2011]
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Central Bank Reform Act 2010
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Central Bank Reform Act 2010 

(Sections 20 and 22) (Amendment) Regulations 2023.
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited central bank reform act 2010 (sections 20 22) (amendment) regulation 2023

title: Reform Act 2010 (Sections 20 and 22) Regulations 2011 [S.I. No. 437 of 2011]
heading: In these Regulations, “Principal Regulations” means the Central Bank
text_raw:
2. 

In these Regulations, “Principal Regulations” means the Central Bank 
Reform Act 2010 (Sections 20 and 22) Regulations 2011 [S.I. No. 437 of 2011] 
as amended.
text_norm: 2 regulation principal regulation mean central bank reform act 2010 (sections 20 22) regulation 2011 s.i no 437 2011 amended

title: Reform Act 2010 (Sections 20 and 22) Regulations 2011 [S.I. No. 437 of 2011]

title: Reform Act 2010 (Sections 20 and 22) Regulations 2011 [S.I. No. 437 of 2011]
heading: 4. These Regulations come into operation on 29 December 2023.
text_raw:
4. These Regulations come into operation on 29 December 2023. 

Signed for and on behalf of the CENTRAL BANK OF IRELAND 
 20 December 2023 

GABRIEL MAKHLOUF, 
 Governor 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 22nd December, 2023. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [663] 3 

Schedule 

“Schedule 2 

Pre-Approval Controlled Functions 

Part 1 

Pre-Approval Controlled Functions 

in relation to 

All Regulated Financial Service Providers (other than a certified person 
within the meaning of section 55 of the Investment Intermediaries Act 
1995)
text_norm: 4 regulation come operation 29 december 2023 signed behalf central bank ireland 20 december 2023 gabriel makhlouf governor notice making statutory instrument published iris oifigiuil 22nd december 2023 663 3 schedule schedule 2 pre-approval controlled function part 1 pre-approval controlled function relation regulated financial service provider (other certified person within meaning section 55 investment intermediary act 1995)

title: Reform Act 2010 (Sections 20 and 22) Regulations 2011 [S.I. No. 437 of 2011]
heading: 1. In the case of a regulated financial service provider that is a body
text_raw:
1. In the case of a regulated financial service provider that is a body 
corporate incorporated in the State, a person who holds or performs the 
duties of any of the following positions or offices in the regulated 
financial service provider: 
(a) the office of: 

(i) executive director (PCF-1), 

(ii) non-executive director (PCF-2A), 

(iii) independent non-executive director (PCF-2B) 

(b) the office of chair of the board (PCF-3), 
(c) the office of chair of the audit committee (PCF-4), 
(d) the office of chair of the risk committee (PCF-5), 
(e) the office of chair of the remuneration committee (PCF-6), 
(f) the office of chair of the nomination committee (PCF-7), 
(g) the office of chief executive (PCF-8), 
(h) the office of chief operating officer (PCF-42).
text_norm: 1 case regulated financial service provider body corporate incorporated state person hold performs duty following position office regulated financial service provider (a) office (i) executive director (pcf-1) (ii) non-executive director (pcf-2a) (iii) independent non-executive director (pcf-2b) (b) office chair board (pcf-3) (c) office chair audit committee (pcf-4) (d) office chair risk committee (pcf-5) (e) office chair remuneration committee (pcf-6) (f) office chair nomination committee (pcf-7) (g) office chief executive (pcf-8) (h) office chief operating officer (pcf-42)

title: Reform Act 2010 (Sections 20 and 22) Regulations 2011 [S.I. No. 437 of 2011]
heading: 2. In the case of a regulated financial service provider that is a partnership
text_raw:
2. In the case of a regulated financial service provider that is a partnership 
established in the State, each member of the partnership except limited 
partners within the meaning of section 3 of the Investment Limited 
Partnerships Act 1994 (PCF-9).
text_norm: 2 case regulated financial service provider partnership established state member partnership except limited partner within meaning section 3 investment limited partnership act 1994 (pcf-9)

title: Reform Act 2010 (Sections 20 and 22) Regulations 2011 [S.I. No. 437 of 2011]
heading: 3. In the case of a regulated financial service provider that is a natural
text_raw:
3. In the case of a regulated financial service provider that is a natural 
person and where that provider has its principal place of business in the 
State, that person (PCF-10).
text_norm: 3 case regulated financial service provider natural person provider principal place business state person (pcf-10)

title: Reform Act 2010 (Sections 20 and 22) Regulations 2011 [S.I. No. 437 of 2011]
heading: 4. In the case of each regulated financial service provider established in
text_raw:
4. In the case of each regulated financial service provider established in 

the State: 
(a) Head of Finance (PCF-11), 
(b) Head of Compliance (PCF-12), 
(c) Head of Internal Audit (PCF-13), 
(d) Chief Risk Officer (PCF-14), 
(e) Branch Manager of a branch established outside the State but only 
where the business arising from the branch amounts to 5% or more 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [663] 

of, as applicable, the assets or revenues or gross written premium of 
the regulated financial service provider (PCF-16), 

(f) Head of Retail Sales (PCF-17), 
(g) Chief Information Officer (PCF-49), 
(h) Head of Anti-Money Laundering and Counter Terrorist Financing 

Compliance (PCF-52). 

Part 2 

Pre-Approval Controlled Functions 

in relation to 

Specified Regulated Financial Service Providers 

A person who performs one or more of the following functions in 
respect of a regulated financial service provider established in the State:
text_norm: 4 case regulated financial service provider established state (a) head finance (pcf-11) (b) head compliance (pcf-12) (c) head internal audit (pcf-13) (d) chief risk officer (pcf-14) (e) branch manager branch established outside state business arising branch amount 5 4 663 applicable asset revenue gross written premium regulated financial service provider (pcf-16) (f) head retail sale (pcf-17) (g) chief information officer (pcf-49) (h) head anti-money laundering counter terrorist financing compliance (pcf-52) part 2 pre-approval controlled function relation specified regulated financial service provider person performs one following function respect regulated financial service provider established state

title: Reform Act 2010 (Sections 20 and 22) Regulations 2011 [S.I. No. 437 of 2011]
heading: 3. In respect of a Market Operator of a Regulated Market within
text_raw:
3. In respect of a Market Operator of a Regulated Market within 
the meaning of the European Communities (Markets in 
Financial Instruments) Regulations 2007: 

a) Head of Traded Markets (PCF-24), 
b) Head of International Primary Markets (PCF-25), 
c) Head of Regulation (PCF-26), 
d) Head of Operations (PCF- 27).

title: Reform Act 2010 (Sections 20 and 22) Regulations 2011 [S.I. No. 437 of 2011]
heading: 4. In respect of :
text_raw:
4. In respect of : 
(a) an Investment Firm within the meaning of the European 
Communities (Markets in Financial Instruments) Regulations 
2007 or an Investment Business Firm authorised or required to 
be authorised under section 10 of the Investment Intermediaries 
Act 1995 other than: 

• an investment business firm which solely carries on the 
business of an investment product intermediary (within 
Investment 
the meaning of section 25 of 
Intermediaries Act 1995); or 

the 

• an entity authorised or required to be authorised under 
section 10 of the Investment Intermediaries Act 1995 
which solely carries out: 

➢ the administration of collective 

investment 
schemes, including the performance of valuation 
services or fund accounting services or acting as 
a transfer agent or a registration agent for such 
schemes; or 

➢ custodial operations involving the safekeeping 
and administration of investment instruments; or 
(b) an alternative investment fund manager within the meaning of 
the European Union (Alternative Investment Fund Managers) 
Regulations 2013: 

1 As reported in quarterly COREP and FINREP regulatory reporting. 

 
 
 
 
 6 [663] 

i. Branch Managers within the State (PCF-28), 
ii. Head of Trading (PCF-29), 
iii. Chief Investment Officer (PCF-30) 

iv. Head of Client Asset Oversight (PCF-45), 
v. Head of Investor Money Oversight (PCF-46). 
vi. Head of Material Business Line (PCF- 55)2 
where such a material business line satisfies 
either of the following quantitative criteria: 

a. has gross total assets equal to or in excess 

of €5 billion; or 

b. accounts for 10 per cent or more of the 

investment firm’s gross revenue

title: Reform Act 2010 (Sections 20 and 22) Regulations 2011 [S.I. No. 437 of 2011]
heading: 9. In this Part, a reference to UCITS Self Managed Investment
text_raw:
9. In this Part, a reference to UCITS Self Managed Investment 
Company shall be taken to mean an investment company within 
the meaning of the European Communities (Undertakings for 
Collective Investment in Transferable Securities) Regulations 
2011 which has not designated a management company. 

Part 3 

Pre-Approval Controlled Functions 

in relation to All 

Regulated Financial Service Providers established outside the State
text_norm: 9 part reference ucits self managed investment company shall taken mean investment company within meaning european community (undertakings collective investment transferable securities) regulation 2011 designated management company part 3 pre-approval controlled function relation regulated financial service provider established outside state

text_raw:

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.)

22) Regulations 2011 (S.I. No. 437 of 2011).
